greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (3^n/n!)*Product_{k=0..n-1}(3*k - 1).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f. (1-9*x)^(1/3)= 1 + 3*x/(G(0)-3*x) where G(k)= (1+9*x)*k + 1 - 3*x - 3*x*(k+1)*(3*k+2)/G(k+1); (continued fraction, Euler's 1st kind, 1-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Jul 07 2012
D-finite with recurrence: n*a(n) +3*(-3*n+4)*a(n-1)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 17 2020
program: (MAGMA) [1] cat [3^n*(&*[3*k-1: k in [0..n-1]])/Factorial(n): n in [1..20]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 22 2019
(Sage) [9^n*rising_factorial(-1/3, n)/factorial(n) for n in (0..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 22 2019
(GAP) List([0..20], n-> 3^n*Product([0..n-1], k-> 3*k-1)/Factorial(n) ); # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 22 2019
results.author: Joe Keane (jgk(AT)jgk.org)
